title: IDEA Child Count and Educational Environments
description: State-level data on the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) Part B, including an unduplicated count of children with disabilities receiving special education from ages 3 through 21 served by the Office of Special Education Programs (OSEP).

options.label: Educational environment, Disability, and School age.
English learner status, Sex, Disability, and Educational environment.
Educational environment, Disability, and Preschool age.
Educational environment, and English learner status.
Services in Regular Early Childhood Program (at least 10 hours)
Other Location Regular Early Childhood Program (at least 10 hours)
Services in Regular Early Childhood Program (less than 10 hours)
Other Location Regular Early Childhood Program (less than 10 hours)
Inside regular class 80% or more of the day
Inside regular class 40% through 79% of the day
Inside regular class less than 40% of the day
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

pages.description: Here's a simplified summary about the data represented in this report:

heading.template: There are {{var_1}} children with various disabilities in your state.

body.template: {{var_1}} are the most prevalent disabilities among the children.

content.title: Disabilities
content.noDataDescription: Unfortunately, there is no data to display for this section. This is due to how the Office of Special Education Programs (OSEP) requires the State's data to be organized.
content.description: The following shows the distribution of children, ages 3-21, with various disabilities in your State.
content.explainTemplate: In the reported data, the top three disability categories in your State are, {{first}}, {{second}}, and {{third}}.

content.title: Sex
